title: Biased conclusions in single-sex personality study

content.question: A psychologist develops a theory of how the personality develops by using case studies using his mostly female patients. What conclusion should be drawn from his reliance on case studies to develop his theory?

choices.label: The psychologist discovered universal truths about human functioning.
The psychologist interviewed patients of all ages to insure broad applicability of his ideas.
The psychologist’s theories were likely biased because they were not based on a representative sample of people.
The small number of case studies he completed reduced the validity of the conclusions he drew.

content.answer: The psychologist’s theories were likely biased because they were not based on a representative sample of people.

topic.text: 4.4: Psychodynamic and Humanistic Theories of Personality

skill.text: 2.A: Determine the type of research design(s) used in a given study.
